00001 #########################################################################
00002 #
00003 #  Implements factorial
00004 #
00005 package Parser::UOP::factorial;
00006 use strict;
00007 our @ISA = qw(Parser::UOP);
00008 
00009 #
00010 #  Check that the operand is a number
00011 #
00012 sub _check {
00013   my $self = shift;
00014   if ($self->{op}->isRealNumber || $self->context->flag("allowBadOperands"))
00015     {$self->{type} = $Value::Type{number}}
00016   else
00017     {$self->Error("Factorial only works on integers")}
00018 }
00019 
00020 #
00021 #  Evaluate the factorial
00022 #
00023 sub _eval {
00024   my $self = shift;
00025   my $n = shift; my $f = 1;
00026   $self->Error("Factorial can only be taken of (non-negative) integers")
00027     unless $n =~ m/^\d+$/;
00028   while ($n > 0) {$f *= $n; $n--}
00029   return $f;
00030 }
00031 
00032 #########################################################################
00033 
00034 #
00035 #  Create a new formula if the function's arguments are formulas
00036 #  Otherwise evaluate the function call.
00037 #
00038 sub call {
00039   my $self = shift;
00040   $self->Error("Factorial requires an argument") if scalar(@_) == 0;
00041   $self->Error("Factorial should have only one argument") unless scalar(@_) == 1;
00042   return $self->_eval(@_) unless Value::isFormula($_[0]);
00043   my $formula = $self->Package("Formula")->blank($self->context);
00044   my @args = Value::toFormula($formula,@_);
00045   $formula->{tree} = $formula->Item("UOP")->new($formula,'!',@args);
00046   return $formula;
00047 }
00048 
00049 sub Error {
00050   my $self = shift;
00051   $self->SUPER::Error(@_) if ref($self);
00052   Value::Error(@_);
00053 }
